Once in a quaint little town, there lived a scruffy dog named Doodle. Unlike any other canine, Doodle possessed an extraordinary talent: he could draw! With a stick in his mouth, he would create masterpieces in the sand at the park. Children gathered around, amazed as he sketched everything from playful puppies to swirling galaxies. One day, a local artist noticed Doodle's talent and decided to showcase his work in an art gallery. The opening night was magical; Doodle became the town's beloved artist. From that day on, Doodle taught everyone that creativity knows no bounds, even in furry friends.
